rev.comment: /* Sexual */ Correction of two further link destinations
/* Sexual */ I have corrected the link destination under the link title "sexual relations" from "Human sexual behavior" to "Human sexual activity".
/* Genetic variability */ -superfluous dot after caption that is not a full sentence
I have directed the link to [[developed world]] directly to [[Developed country]], which it is a redirect to.
Journal cites (journal naming):, added 1 DOI, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7856)
/* Acute infection */ (-) figure contradicted by reference (see talk page)
/* Transmission */ Greater emphasis on factors that can raise transmission rates substantially
Adding 0 [[arXiv|arxiv eprint(s)]], 21 [[bibcode|bibcode(s)]] and 0 [[digital object identifier|doi(s)]]. Did it miss something? Report bugs, errors, and suggestions at [[User talk:Bibcode Bot]]
/* Genetic variability */ made changes per edit request
/* Structure and genome */Journal cites:, added 1 issue number, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7794)
/* AIDS denialism */Journal cites:, added 1 Bibcode, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7751)
/* Immunomodulatory agents */ wording more proportional to reliable sources
/* Stem cell transplantation */ refactoring for clarity, same spirit as prior edit above
/* Treatment */ del "publicly available", per comment on talk page. No idea why it was expressed like this.
/* Prevention */ Elaboration of HIV vaccines and current trials.
Undid revision 436440160 by [[Special:Contributions/MuzeMarc|MuzeMarc]] ([[User talk:MuzeMarc|talk]])revert, again this is UNDUE; take it to talk to get consensus
Obviously, anyone who is HIV+ and has been denied [[HAART]] cares. Please stop vandalizing the HIV page.

Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/Aparagraph|Aparagraph]] ([[User talk:Aparagraph|talk]]): Per [[WP:UNDUE]]. Who cares what they do in SF, this is an international encyclopedia. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
Undid revision 436048340 by [[Special:Contributions/Yobol|Yobol]] ([[User talk:Yobol|talk]]) rvt unexplained deletion of refferenced material/vandalism
Reverted to revision 432268112 by Sigveholmen: I'm not sure this is necessary. Seems like overdo.. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Signs and symptoms */ replaced graph with SVG
/* Treatment */ ,,,collecting additional info on prevention of transmission...
Fix cite template param names, publishyear -> year, publishyear -> year, publishyear -> year, using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7701)
Primarily? Unless I'm badly mistaken, it's only.
Word choice - "antiretroviral drug" is more specific than "antiretroviral treatment", also burden of poverty
/* Signs and symptoms */ ce; discrepancy between stages here and the following sections
/* Signs and symptoms */ LTNP vs elites
/* Signs and symptoms */ combining paragraphs and tweaks for accuracy
/* Signs and symptoms */ ce and explain viral load
/* Classification */ the cell doesn't enter, the virus enters the cell; converted=reverse transcribed
/* Classification */ in common with each other
no massive reduction, but "turn of the tide"
immune failure doesn't cause OIs, but allows them to thrive; also cancers
progressive failure: AIDS isn't just the beginning of immune failure
/* Discovery */ fixed montagnier source url w/ cite doi template
/* Virus entry inhibitors */ rm: the citation is wrong and there doesn't yet appear to be evidence for this being a major conceptual or therapeutic advance
/* Stem cell transplantation */ update to the stem cell section
/* Research */ Moving Banlec to the talk page
/* Research */ rm primary, in vitro work and news report

rv: please do not delete content without discussing and/or tagging it first, as instructed on the talk page. This is a high-traffic and important article, and it's important to obtain consensus before making major changes.

Undid revision 418026557 by [[Special:Contributions/MuzeMarc|MuzeMarc]] ([[User talk:MuzeMarc|talk]])Let's discuss these changes on the talk page; controversial topic scientifically and don't want to "blame the victim"
/* Origins */Rm ordinal suffix superscript per [[WP:ORDINAL]] + [[WP:GENFIXES]], replaced: <sup>th</sup> → th (4) using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (7618)
Undid revision 413938469 by [[Special:Contributions/MrSativa|MrSativa]] ([[User talk:MrSativa|talk]]) Appears to be [[WP:SYNTH]] - pleas take to talk page to get consensus before re-adding

Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/MrSativa|MrSativa]] ([[User talk:MrSativa|talk]]); Clear [[WP:SYNTH|synthesis]], citing three primary articles, then a review-type article that does not mention HIV in its discussion/con
/* AIDS denialism */ HIV test for secondary schools
/* Entry to the cell */ This sentence needs to be improved, for now I'm deleting it. Please spell out dNTP and rNTP. Explaination could be clearer - maybe a second sentence is warranted.
/* Other treatments being researched */ + Immunomodulatory agents
r2.5.2) (robot Modifying: [[es:Virus de la inmunodeficiencia humana]]
Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/FILWISE|FILWISE]] ([[User talk:FILWISE|talk]]); There is currently no vacine therefore not a treatment. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
moving the research material to being a subsection of "treatment" (as all hte research relates to treatment)
/* External links */ removing AIDS.gov, as it has a United States-only focus; other links, though sometimes US-based, appear international in scope
/* External links */ trimming ELs - don't need Americal Psych Association page on AIDS on a WP article on HIV
restore infection rate chart per apparent talk page consensus; fix botched ref
/* Stem cell transplantation */ nuke redundant date
Citations: [215] added: postscript. Tweaked: pmc, doi_brokendate, author, issue, pmid, last5, first5, pages. Unified citation types. [[User:Rjwilmsi|Rjwilmsi]]
/* Virus Entry Inhibitor VIR-576 */ reworked citations and retittled
/* Virus Entry Inhibitor VIR-576 */ editing down given the very early nature of this work - there are many papers like this published
/* Virus Entry Inhibitor VIR-576 */ move this section to research
/* Research */ rewrote, split into two sections
/* Research */ removed news story, full citation for Blood article
we have the image on the subpage
looks bad to trap text between images
people can click on them to make them larger, than those of us who set default image sizes can use them
if these are important combine them into the text
/* Origins */ Removing redundancy. My apologies if I am edit conflicting someone making an edit regarding the man who was apparently cured.
Changed protection level of HIV: Maybe the edit warring is over. If not, there will be blocks. ([edit=autoconfirmed] (indefinite) [move=sysop] (indefinite))
Changed protection level of HIV: [[WP:PPOL#Content disputes|Edit warring / Content dispute]] ([edit=sysop] (expires 19:01, 23 October 2010 (UTC)) [move=sysop] (indefinite))
once again, see tak page. insert again without consensus and I will take this issue to WP:ANI or WP:BLPN
/* AIDS denialism */ Treatment guidelines are clear on this point. [[Antiretroviral]] therapy is indicated for any infected individual who is mature enough to use them responsibly.
This is not a soapbox; the style is not MOS-compliant; the refs are incomplete; it violates BLP. Take to the talk page or I will take it to ANI
/* AIDS denialism */ I agree that the definition of "denialism" is unclear. Some users still oppose clarification.
/* AIDS denialism */ this section needs to be clearer
A reminder - talk page first, please - i have posted both there and on KBlott's page re this
Re-read the text. The definition of denialism includes "the validity of ... treatment methods." Consensus therefore exists, except among denialists (such as yourself).
This has been addressed at the talk page - please don't reintroduce this again without consensus
/* AIDS denialism */ Denial that HIV causes AIDS is only one form of [[Denialism]] that is common in the HIV community. Discussion of that issue belongs HERE.
Undid revision 390546776 by [[Special:Contributions/KBlott|KBlott]] ([[User talk:KBlott|talk]]) Assuming good faith, but the edit does not improve the article.
/* Treatments in development */add ref for this statement, and detail
/* Treatments in development */ added back info - see talk

/* Treatments in development */ more neutral wording, no need to duplicate journal name in text, removal of press release and "it may be years" language - simpler to say it hasn't been tested in human
/* Treatments in development */ keep things short - we can't let the "in development" section become a shopping list of every research team's media releases
/* Treatment */ starting to sort the cite
/* Treatment */ avoiding undue weight, avoiding unhelpful redlinks; ref fix to come
moving sentences to "treatment" from "denialism"; returning to earlier version of section on deniliasm; adding cite tag
/* The human rights debate */ + adding citation provided by Scray.
re condom use - neither the original text, nor its deletion, were entirely accurate. Attempting to improve. The key page is 14, not 7 (which is a methodological model)
the number stated here (condom use reduces risk of infection by 85% is simply not true. the referenced paper says, the correct use of condoms reduces the risk of infection to 0 (check page 7).
/* Denialism and HIV/AIDS */ See [[Talk:HIV# Treatment denialism]].
/* AIDS denialism */ redundant and not directly addressing denialism
/* Treatment */ more accurately reflecting observational, not randomized, nature of cited NA-ACCORD study - was tempted to add that there were very few deaths in that study
/* References */ + Guidelines for antiretroviral therapy for HIV infection. Canadian HIV Trials Network
/* Treatment */ + Effect of early versus deferred antiretroviral therapy for HIV on survival.
/* Chronic HIV infection */ + Effect of early versus deferred antiretroviral therapy for HIV on survival.
/* References */ + Effect of early versus deferred antiretroviral therapy for HIV on survival
/* Latency stage */ The term ''latent'' is inaccurate. (In the absence of therapy, the virus is ''always'' active.)
Rescuing orphaned refs ("Boily_et_al" from rev 385604169; "Coovadia" from rev 385604169; "Millett_et_al" from rev 385604169)
Got rid of infection rate chart with a vengeance. You can't just stick random numbers from different studies. Or have more than 10,000 infections per 10,000 exposures.

/* Origins */ Dr. Marx believes that the crucial event was the introduction into Africa of millions of inexpensive, mass-produced syringes in the 1950s.
